subject: Re: How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test
msgSnippet: ... order ... it is ... build ... through ... will ... it ... be there. It is true what you say, any way concerning the open-clossed principle the framework
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...>
wrote:
>
> > Under jUnit, I can modify life cicle of the running process in
order
> > to make tests, why not to let the user to alter also some
> > configuration information for example: classpath (and probably
it is
> > possible, specifying some class loader mechanism, but I am not an
> > expert on that)
>
> Every framework should decide which features are common enough to
build
> into the framework and which features should be implemented
through
> extensions. No matter which decision the framework makes, someone
will
> think it's wrong. Since frameworks should be as small as possible,
it
> makes sense to include only those features we are certain should
be there.

It is true what you say, any way concerning the open-clossed
principle the framework (every framework try to acomplish it) should
be closed for modification, but open for extension, as you know for
sure (also The selfish class article is a good recipe for makeing
good frameworks).

I guess jUnit modifies the class loader mechanism. It allows the
user to change the start (setup() method) and the end of the process
(teardown() method). Such are the open points on the process. If the
class loader mechanism (something that happen at the begining) is
modified, why not to let the user to configurate the classpath,
because such modification shouldn't affect the intention of the test.

A advanced user could expect, following the open-close principle, to
allow the user at the begining (open point) to change the classpath
that could affect the whole process of a given testing method.

This is my mental process about this problem, that respect the idea
about what is framework.

The use of Ant invites to people to go to other framework, for doing
something, that could provide a framework allowing advanced users to
modify the class loader mechanism via open-clossed principle in
order to modify the classpath.

Thanks any way for your opinion, it make me think and reflect about
all this.

David
